Interface GameOutputAdapter<OutputType>

Type Parameters:
OutputType - The type of raw output.
All Known Implementing Classes:
GUIOutputGameAdapter, OutputGameAdapter
public interface GameOutputAdapter<OutputType>
Defines the contract for sending game updates to clients. This interface abstracts the output layer, allowing the game logic to send information without knowing if the client is using a Console or a GUI. Implementations of this interface handle the specific formatting and transmission protocols.

  • Method Details

    • registerPlayer

      void registerPlayer(PlayerColor color, PrintWriter out)
      Registers a player and associates them with an output stream. This method binds a specific PlayerColor to a network socket output, allowing the server to direct messages to the correct client.
      Parameters:
      color - The color of the player to register.
      out - The PrintWriter stream connected to the client's socket.

    • unregisterPlayer

      void unregisterPlayer(PlayerColor color)
      Removes a player from the active connections list. This is typically called when a client disconnects or the game ends, ensuring no further messages are attempted to be sent to a closed socket.
      Parameters:
      color - The color of the player to remove.

    • sendState

      void sendState(GameState gameState, PlayerColor target)
      Sends the current state of the game to the specified target. Used to inform players about whose turn it is, if the game has ended, or if they are waiting for an opponent.
      Parameters:
      gameState - The current status of the game logic.
      target - The recipient (Specific player or BOTH).

    • sendBoard

      void sendBoard(Board board, PlayerColor target)
      Sends the current board layout to the specified target. The implementation determines how the board is represented: - Console adapter: Sends an ASCII art string. - GUI adapter: Sends protocol commands (e.g., UPDATE WHITE 10 10).
      Parameters:
      board - The current game board object.
      target - The recipient (Specific player or BOTH).

    • sendExceptionMessage

      void sendExceptionMessage(Exception exception, PlayerColor target)
      Sends an error or exception message to a specific player. This is used to notify a player about invalid moves or rule violations without crashing the server.
      Parameters:
      exception - The exception containing the error details.
      target - The player who caused the error.

    • sendBroadcast

      void sendBroadcast(String message)
      Broadcasts a generic message to all connected players.
      Parameters:
      message - The message content to send.
